Election 2023: Concern over lack of family violence focus from main parties - ‘completely missing’ in crime discussions https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/election-2023-concern-over-lack-of-family-violence-focus-from-main-parties-completely-missing-in-crime-discussions/ EQI37ZUUBJEYJBBITMOBF2E3ZY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/election-2023-concern-over-lack-of-family-violence-focus-from-main-parties-completely-missing-in-crime-discussions/ EQI37ZUUBJEYJBBITMOBF2E3ZY/ Michael NeilsonWhile crime has been a major focus, the biggest component has been absent in campaigning. Tenancy Tribunal orders landlords to fork out almost $10,000 after harassing tenants on shared property https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tenancy-tribunal-orders-landlords-to-fork-out-almost-10000-after-harassing-tenants-on-shared-property/FGL775ITBVHBPKT3P65IDMZNYY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tenancy-tribunal-orders-landlords-to-fork-out-almost-10000-after-harassing-tenants-on-shared-property/FGL775ITBVHBPKT3P65IDMZNYY/ Emily MoorhouseThe landlords removed the tenants' belongings from a shared shed and locked it. Wed, 11 Oct 2023 05:00:00 +0000 The landlords were ordered to fork out almost $10,000 for breaching their obligations including harassing their tenants by playing loud music late into the night and locking them out of a shared shed.
